A **spellbook of drain life** allows you to learn the **drain life** spell.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)

  - [1.1 Monsters](#Monsters)
  - [1.2 Objects](#Objects)
  - [1.3 Yourself](#Yourself)

- [2 Messages](#Messages)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Effects

### Monsters

Casting it at a monster drains one [level](/wiki/Monster_level "Monster level") from it, does 1d8 × 2 damage, and decreases the monster's maximum [HP](/wiki/HP "HP") by 1d8 (with spell bonuses applicable to both). The base damage and HP reduction is doubled if you are a [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight") carrying [the Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/The_Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "The Magic Mirror of Merlin"). The monster's location will be revealed, if it is unseen.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) If the monster resists the spell through [monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance"), it will not be level drained, will suffer only 25% damage to its current HP, and will suffer no damage to its max HP.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Monsters with [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") are not affected at all.

### Objects

If the spell is cast at an object, the object will resist 90% of the time if it is an artifact, or 10% of the time otherwise. If the object does not resist, its charge or enchantment is reduced by 1. An object cannot have its charge or enchantment reduced below zero, and any objects with negative enchantments are unaffected.

### Yourself

Casting the spell at yourself drains one [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") with the usual message, as if you were hit with a monster's [drain life](/wiki/Drain_life_\(monster_attack\) "Drain life (monster attack)") attack, unless you are [drain resistant](/wiki/Drain_resistant "Drain resistant"). Losing a level reduces your maximum hit points and your hit points by the same amount, down to a minimum of one. If you are drained below experience level 1, you [die](/wiki/Die "Die").

## Messages

- \<Monster> suddenly seems weaker!

  A monster was hit with a drain life spell and did not resist.

## Strategy

Drain life is not a great attack spell. It does not deal much damage, and you will not gain as many experience points since they are based on the monster's experience level before dying. On the other hand, it is worthwhile for extended battles with certain very tough opponents that are [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") and teleport away to heal themselves, but are not [100% magic resistant](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), such as [Master Kaen](/wiki/Master_Kaen "Master Kaen"). Though they may heal their HP, they cannot recover their drained levels and will eventually die.

It can be used to kill enemies behind [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") without breaking the boulder, making it invaluable in [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") if you do not have [magic missile](/wiki/Spellbook_of_magic_missile "Spellbook of magic missile") or [projectiles](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile").

This spell is also commonly used to reduce the enchantment of a weapon from +6 to +5, from where you may safely re-attempt to enchant it to +7, and also to reduce armor from +4 to +3 for the same purpose (+5 for elven armor). It works on [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane") too, but usually requires several attempts, and is done to change the additional effects it has upon striking enemies.

## History

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and earlier versions, this spell could be used to reduce your level in a controlled way in order to get massive amounts of maximum HP, maximum Pw, and intrinsic protection. This strategy was known as [drain for gain](/wiki/Drain_for_gain "Drain for gain").

## SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces [wands of draining](/wiki/Wand_of_draining "Wand of draining"), which have the same effects as this spell when zapped.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [zap.c in NetHack 3.6.1, line 3962](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.1_Release/zap.c#L3962)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [zap.c in NetHack 3.6.1, line 401](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.1_Release/zap.c#L401)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [zap.c in NetHack 3.6.1, line 4933](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.1_Release/zap.c#L4933)
